definition: branch/stem/stalk/CL:根[gen1]/to block/to hinder/(Tw) interesting, fresh, or amusing subject matter or scenario

sentences.english: Mary abstracted a story for the book review.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽为这篇书评写故事梗概。

sentences.english: A sketch of the long report by the budget committee was submitted to the mayor for approval.
sentences.chinese: 预算委员会的长篇报告的梗概已提交市长批示。

sentences.english: Outline your story using the information you learned from your interviews.
sentences.chinese: 用采访收集到的信息概括出内容梗概。

sentences.english: He is abstracting a story for a book review.
sentences.chinese: 他正在为一篇书评撰写故事梗概。

sentences.english: And so you come up with pretty good proxies for the baby population.
sentences.chinese: 所以，你便对婴儿人口的数量略知梗概。

sentences.english: Recall that this feed provides only a synopsis to the user.
sentences.chinese: 别忘了，此提要只为用户提供一个梗概。

sentences.english: Please tell us the name of your movie and briefly summarize the story line.
sentences.chinese: 请告诉我们电影的名字及故事梗概。

sentences.english: He retained the broad outline of the tragedy but not the details of the play.
sentences.chinese: 他记得这出悲剧的梗概，但戏的细节已不记得了。

sentences.english: The following are principles extracted from that email interview.
sentences.chinese: 以下这些梗概都是摘自我的邮件采访。

sentences.english: A preliminary survey and comments on future studies of Chinese Liliaceae.
sentences.chinese: 中国百合科的系统梗概及对今后研究的一些意见。

sentences.english: Wood roughed out a possible framework for their story.
sentences.chinese: 伍德为他们的故事勾勒出了一个合理的梗概。

sentences.english: Please give me a general idea of the work.
sentences.chinese: 请告诉我这项工作的梗概。

sentences.english: Perhaps you would kindly give me a sketch of the course of events from memory.
sentences.chinese: 也许你愿意根据记忆把全案的梗概谈一谈吧。

sentences.english: Did everyone get a handout of the outline of Luke and Acts?
sentences.chinese: 所有人都拿到路加福音和使徒行传的梗概了吗？

definition: to relate (a story or information)/to tell or talk about/to recount/narration/telling/narrative/account
to abridge (a text)/to edit out (of a movie)/to cut back (a budget, a curriculum)
start of literary work/opening song of ballad in Tanci style 彈詞|弹词[tan2 ci2]
impression of a book/opinion expressed in a book review
impression or feeling after visiting or watching (movies, museums etc)
